intro: Adenocalymma trifoliatum var. trichoclada, commonly known as the three-leaved adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet having a hairy underside. It produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. This variant is distinguished by its dense, glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance.
